alert.note: Alert for San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 10:19PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Brown and San Saba Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1018 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms in Mason, San Saba, and Brown counties, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brownwood, San Saba, Early, Richland Springs, Algerita, Cherokee, Bangs, Blanket, Chappel, Sloan, Elm Grove, Winchell, Zephyr, Brookesmith, Camp Bowie, Skeeterville, Hall, Locker, Harkeyville and Owens. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
